column4: i am running live cd right now and want to delete my old 7.10 partitions to install 8.04, how do i do this
Don't you want anything from your old 7.10?
no i dont need anything from that.
Then after you boot in the livecd, go to the partition editor, and you can delete the partition.
i am trying, but my swap and extended partitions are locked or something and cannot be deleted
Or reformat it to ext3 again.
dont touch swap and extended partitions.
Why do you want to delete the whole thing and install fresh?

because i was having sound problems and figured this was the best way to solve it.  i was running 8.04 last night and it worked perfectly, i just messed up all my partitions and now i dont know what i am doing.
so i would like to just reinstall and correct all of my partitions.
Normally, you do all the partition stuff first and then install ubuntu.
yeah i know, i was actually doing it manually with the partition editor while installing, but i messed it up through there
If you use liveCD you should be able to delete all partitions.
i have my xp partition and an extended and swap partitions, what should i do during installation
Do you want to keep your XP?
yes, for a little while longer anyways
Ok, boot liveCD, go to partition editor, delete extended and swap (hoping you dont need them). Then reformat available space as ext3, and then 2*RAM size as swap.
After that is done, then proceed to installing ubuntu.
Is the swap size ok now? like is it double your RAM?
If it is, then just leave it as it is.
just reformat extended. delete it and make it ext3
